body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Fees & Passes              Fees & Passes       The Mary McLeod Bethune Council House National Historic Site is free and open to the public. Drop-in visits are welcome from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. The last guided tour leaves at 4:00 p.m.   Groups of 10 or more are encouraged to make reservations by calling (202) 673-2402.   The National Archives for Black Women's History is open by appointment only.
title:
Mary McLeod Bethune Council House National Historic Site
: Fees & Passes
